message: While stretching, I glance at the digital clock on the counter.
This is Hum-Drum Junk, a shop that carries everything from basic supplies to specialized parts, all at rock-bottom prices.
The dorky name was what drew me in. Just how long has it been since I started working here, anyway? A while, that's for sure.
I'm leaning on the counter, spacing out, when the Coil on my arm beeps.
A Coil is like a mobile phone, but better.
You can make calls, send texts, watch TV, pay for things, and even use it as an ID―all in one little machine.

Is this some new viral ad?<K>
Like, the adult kind?
I'm sure the rest of it says something like, "I'm in trouble. Only a big strong man like you can save me."
Suddenly, something slams into my side.
I fall from the chair, and something heavy lands on my back.
Three voices giggle overhead. I know right away who it is.
It's Kio, Nao, and Mio, a trio of siblings from the neighborhood whose only purpose, it seems, is to make my life hell.

name: 蒼葉
message: "How many times have I told you this isn't a playground?! Don't you kids listen?!"

name: ナオ
message: "Hey! Aoba's looking at a dirty e-mail!"
Nao must've gotten a look at my Coil. The other two climb up my back, trying to get a peek.

name: ナオ
message: "Dirty e-mail! Dirty e-mail! Aoba's a pervert!"

name: キオ
message: "Nuh-uh! I bet it's someone wanting to buy bad stuff! 'Cuz this shop is sketchy!"

name: キオ
message: "I know! Let's arrest Aoba for being perverted and sketch!"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Guh, ugh... Get off me already, you braaaaaaaaats!"
I jump up, shaking them off. Not gonna hold back just 'cause they're kids.
If I thought scolding them would accomplish anything, I'd do it. But this bunch doesn't give a rat's ass what I have to say.

name: ナオ
message: "Hey! What's that thing on top of the shelf?"
As I expected, their attention has already moved on to other things.
The screen of my Coil catches my eye. Download complete. The hell?
I do recall it making a weird noise earlier...
Maybe I accidentally pushed a button while I was wrestling with the brats.
I hope I didn't download some weird program...
Before I can investigate, the old-fashioned bell on the front door rings.

name: 羽賀
message: "Phew, the deliveries were all over the place today."
Mr. Haga's smile vanishes as soon as he sees the kids.
I guess that's the natural reaction when you consider the kind of damage they always do.

name: 羽賀
message: "N-Now children, it's dangerous to play inside the shop. You might get hurt."
The temperature in the room suddenly drops ten degrees.

name: 羽賀
message: "...Dear, sweet children, I hate to be a bother..."

name: 羽賀
message: "Come on, say it again! The first syllable was... ba?"

name: ナオ
message: "Ba... Ba... Bad! I feel bad! My stomach hurts, so... I'm going home!"
The evil trio dashes from the store.

name: 羽賀
message: "...Ba...? What came after ba... Ba what...?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hey, boss! I just remembered. Good news!"
I scramble for the words that'll snap him out of it.

name: 蒼葉
message: "We've been getting tons of orders for the S series A parts!"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yes! You're amazing! It's just like you said! Sales are up fifty percent from last month!"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yes it is! Things are looking up! Sales are doubling!"

name: 羽賀
message: "We should stock some more if they're selling that well."
I breathe a sigh of relief. That was close. There's no telling what Mr. Haga might do once something sets him off.
Finally calm, he straightens his glasses and gives me a tired smile.

name: 羽賀
message: "Goodness... Those children are nothing but trouble, aren't they?"

name: 羽賀
message: "They might be cute if they weren't such troublemakers..."
No matter how many times I've seen it happen, it's always startling when his personality does a 180 like that.
Mr. Haga walks to the counter and grabs a paper bag from the floor.

name: 羽賀
message: "I hate to ask you to do this, but would you mind dropping this off with the courier service? You can head on home after that."

name: 羽賀
message: "Yes. In fact, I'm expecting someone soon, so I thought I'd close up early today."
I shoulder my bag and take the package from Mr. Haga.
From the label, it looks like it's going pretty far. Fortunately, getting it there is the courier's job, not mine.
